name: placable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you describe a person as placable, you mean that it is easy to keep them calm when they start to become angry or upset: He was a placable fellow with a mild temper. I stepped in and took her to one side, and she immediately became placable.
More examplesFewer examplesShe could never be described as a kind or placable sort of woman. The king had a generous and placable nature.She believed that the gods were always placable and that they treated everyone with love.
